page.title: 18NARROWBOAT HOME,STOKE PRIOR
page.content: I have lived on a{narrowboat}since I was two and a half years old.The boat is fifty years old and 21.6m long.It used to carry coal on the Grand Union Canal from London to Birmingham.It has a motor and used to pull a butty which was originally paired with ours. We have a Rayburn cooker in the kitchen which heats the radiators,and a turtle stove in one of the bedrooms. In the winter the boat is usually much warmer than a house.We have no mains electricity, but run the lights and the television from 12 volt batteries. Water is stored in big tanks under the floor.We keep the coal in the forward hatch or on the roof. Sometimes it is fun living on a narrowboat, especially when we are moving, but sometimes I would rather live in a nice house with a garden.
